title: dear boards we do NOT = the entire lol community
body:
ok all the time here i see that...omg i hate this item or this champ is broke or i hate this system and it will have 100+ upvotes and at the absolute highest end they might get 1k...and they say "so Riot what are you going to do the community has spoken" <- actual quote from a thread with maybe 300 upvotes

so now...
league had 60 million+ monthly players....and what something like 7 million+ playing concurrently guess what 1k upvotes is literally nothing compared to the grand scheme of league ya its a good sample of opinions but by NO mean is it the opinion of the lol community it may be the opinion of the boards community but not lol

and something like 600 upvotes is around 0.001% of the player base

and dont forget the whole vocal minority thing , many times when you have the community hates this its just the vocal minority

Edit: guys when you take a percentage you have to multiply by 100 after dividing >.<

This. So much fucking this.

That's why these boards are the worst place to get balance ideas from.
Skarner buff was asked on PBE boards. PBE boards != NA boards.

In Lux's defense the initial "buff Lux" spread was back when her E was inferior to alll other wave-clearing spells of the long-range champions. Cost more, did less, had a longer cooldown, less range, and so on- that was plenty fair and needed imo.
True, but I think it was gated because of how oppressive it was.

The main reason for that is that (aside from the incredibly rare gratitude posts) all of the feedback is negative.
You can get a sense of what some people DONT like, but its hard to represent people who are content with the current system. You're just not going to go onto the boards to say "THIS IS OK!"
How many posts have you seen saying:
 "nerf/buff X champion! RITO PLS" vs "X CHAMPION IS SO BALANCED WOW!" ?
I assume the people who are content are the ones who downvote the posts that state x champion needs whatever because downvotes are a quick way to disagree.

Sadly, downvotes are not a remotely decent way to disagree with someone. Their point is to push down content that does not contribute, not to disagree with someone. It'd be literally no different than someone's reply being "I disagree" and never explaining why.

It's always a pain to try to talk sense into the people that complain about a certain topic, because that's half their incentive to go on the boards: **To complain about changes they personally don't like.**

Nowadays I just like to peruse posts by more friendly people like Laughing Fish and Malicious Metal.

Amen brother.
Not to mention the boards self-select because the people who are mature enough to not panic over every minor change are just playing the game and enjoying it.

Who cares if we are the vocal minority? We are the voice of the community because we care enough to post and give feedback.

Sure the others may play the game but they could just like that leve the game because it doesn't mean that much to them.

The issue is that not only are the boards the vocal minority, but they are the vocal minority where only complaint threads against Riot are tolerated.  Most of the time, if someone says something positive about Riot and what they are doing, they get down-voted into oblivion by all the people just here to complain.  This causes people on the other side of the coin just to leave the boards because they know their opinion won't be heard.  Because of this, the boards are far from the best place for Riot to get feedback on the game state, as only one side is represented.

You dislike U.R.F because it's overrated and not really fun? Get downvoted to oblivion.
You defend DynamicQ because it's literally no problem in low elo? How dare you?

The "vocal minority" actually sucks because the vocal minorities majority just wants to complain about x item and y champion. (There are a few exceptions here and there)
Y champion being {{champion:11}}

This has actually happened to me when I said Riot did a actually good buff on Shyvana, and people complained and downvoted me going on about her winrates from BEFORE the buff.

Some people are just unsatisfied no matter what.

I think the community wants a League of Legends story quest game like Skyrim except with more Draven. That seems doable. If Riot can't even do that they need to give us unlimited RP as compensation. The community has spoken.

People post threads to complain, not to praise.  This makes sense (there's not a lot to discuss in a thread about how great Dynamic Queue is, for instance), but it means the boards will always give more visibility to criticism.  The community looks like it's upset because everyone who goes out of their way to express an opinion is being critical.  People need to keep in mind that just because the boards look negative doesn't mean the community at large hates the game.  The boards looked exactly the same in previous seasons.

I understand this but sometimes we ask for things that don't require the whole population to agree on. If a good amount of people are asking for Solo Queue to be an available option, there is no saying "Well not enough people want this and we don't want to effect those who don't want solo queue" because if you don't want x, there would be y (vice versa). 

Also certain requests (especially balance-wise) are too blatant and understandable to ignore and say "not enough people vote on this"

When someone doesn't like a change, what are the chances for that person to go straight to the boards to voice their opinion about it?
People who never goes to the boards suddenly rushed to them to complain about dynamic queue and the lack of a solo queue.
The boards is one of the first place people will go to complain about something because that's the most obvious way to express their discontentment.

A couple hundreds of people agreeing on something doesn't make it right.
Why would those who think Dynamic Queue is fine come to the boards to voice their opinion? They aren't discontent so they have nothing to do here.

The boards are a terrible place to make requests or voice your opinion. It is skewed and the only way to get upvotes is to agree with the angry mob or make a post that is simply too good to not agree on.

I 100% Agree with you.

But if those who want solo queue are the only ones in discontentment, why can't Riot release a Solo Queue for those people. I mean if it took up system resources then I could see why.

> The boards are a terrible place to make requests or voice your opinion. It is skewed and the only way to get upvotes is to agree with the angry mob or make a post that is simply too good to not agree on.

Couldn't agree more.

Well, if I dare explain why I believe Riot can't simply release Solo Queue, I'd get downvoted to hell and back like every time I tried to make such a post.
But well... here I go...

There is two side to the coin. On one side, you have the problems it would help fixing. On the other side, the problems it would add or worsen. (Omg! How dare I say that adding Solo Queue will create problems! +40 downvotes inc)
Riot can't simply make the change because they could end up shooting themselves in the foot by doing it. So instead, they keep it on the back burner while they try to find a solution that would solve the issues a Solo Queue could solve without the need of a Solo Queue.

One change they made, which was a really good one, was that Diamond and up could only queue with people 2 ranks below instead of the entire division. No more Diamond 1 with Plat 5. This is a change that could potentially be seen at lower division, but it may become too restrictive at the same time. For example, I can't play with my Diamond 5 friend in ranked until I reach Plat 2 (I'm Plat 4 right now).

In short, replacing problems with new ones doesn't solve anything, it just means they have to scrap every ideas they had to try to solve the new problems. If they can't find any solutions to the problems a Solo Queue would fix, maybe then they will add Solo Queue and try to fix the new problems instead.

And in any case, as much as I want to agree that Solo Queue would be nice, I simply can't. For the reason mentioned above and really... How can I? People are complaining that they lose because of Dynamic queue when myself, I get a S+ with Nami (And let me tell ya, S+ with Nami is absolutely not easy to get) as a solo queue in a game with 4 man premades on both sides... It's not like as a solo queuer I was powerless to win because there are premades in the game... in fact, I feel like I have a much greater impact in those games because l'm the one who will make or break my team in the end. Maybe it's because I don't play with the mentality that premades are going to ruin the game for me?
So yeah. I can't agree with solo queue.
Also Riot doesn't really care too much about the boards, Reddit is way more important as a platform.

I'm sure that despite what a lot of people think, Riot employees read almost all threads. When I come across threads like these I just imagine a Rioter throwing his hands up and just yelling, "fking thank you". Lmao.
